result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:07 AM Defendant William Arthor Hook appeared by phone, in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Jeffrey A Jaeger appeared by phone for William Arthor Hook.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State notes global offer was made regarding all cases.
Atty Collier notes that he emailed DA Urmanski and verbal Global Offer received from ADA Gabler is different from written offer. 
Court will step off the bench and allow parties to talk.
(Court goes off record)
10:28am - Court recalls.
Parties have reached a resolution and are requesting another plea/sentencing date in a couple weeks.
Deft does not want to be produced for plea/sentencing hearing.
Court schedules plea/sentencing by phone.
Atty Jaeger notes his case is being Dismissed so he will not be filing a plea questionnaire.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

  Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia.
